action.action-desc: Ms. Scanlon (for herself and Mr. Raskin) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Oversight and Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To direct the Director of the Bureau of Justice Statistics to establish a database with respect to corporate offenses, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Corporate Crime Database Act of 2022.

section.header: Corporate crime database at the Bureau of Justice Statistics

subsection.text: Part C of title I of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 (34 U.S.C. 10131 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The term business entity means a corporation, association, partnership, limited liability company, limited liability partnership, or other legal entity.
The term corporate offense means—

subparagraph.text: a violation or alleged violation of Federal law committed by—

clause.text: an individual employed by a business entity within the conduct of the individual's occupational role; and

subparagraph.text: any other violation determined by the Director to be a corporate offense.

paragraph.text: The term Director means the Director of the Bureau.

The term enforcement action includes any concluded administrative, civil, or criminal enforcement action or any declination, settlement, deferred prosecution agreement, or non-prosecution agreement entered into by a Federal agency to enforce a law or regulation.
The term Federal agency has the meaning given the term agency in section 551 of title 5, United States Code.

subsection.text: Beginning not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the Corporate Crime Database Act of 2022, the Director shall—

paragraph.text: collect, aggregate, and analyze information regarding enforcement actions taken with respect to corporate offenses; and
publish on the internet website of the Bureau a database of the enforcement actions described in paragraph (1).

subsection.text: The database established under subsection (b) shall include the following information on an enforcement action with respect to corporate offenses:

paragraph.text: Each business entity or individual identified by the enforcement action.
The employer of an individual identified under paragraph (1), as determined relevant by the Director.
The parent company of a business entity identified under paragraph (1) or the parent company of any employer identified under paragraph (2), as determined relevant by the Director.
The type of offense or alleged offense committed by the business entity or individual.
Any relevant statute or regulation violated by the business entity or individual.
Each Federal agency bringing the enforcement action.
The outcome of the enforcement action, if any, including all documentation relevant to the outcome.
An unique identifier for each business entity, individual, employer, or parent company identified by the enforcement action.
Any additional information the Director determines necessary to carry out the purposes of this section.

Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of the Corporate Crime Database Act of 2022, the Director shall establish guidance for the collection of information from each Federal agency that carries out an enforcement action with respect to corporate offenses, including identification of each Federal agency that shall submit information to the Director and the manner in which, time at which, and frequency with which the information shall be submitted.

To the extent to which information is available, the database established under subsection (b) shall include the information described in subsection (c) on each enforcement action with respect to corporate offenses taken by a Federal agency before, on, or after the date of enactment of the Corporate Crime Database Act of 2022.

Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the Corporate Crime Database Act of 2022, the Director shall publish on the internet website of the Bureau the database established under subsection (b) in a format that is searchable, downloadable, and accessible to the public.
The Director shall update the information included in the database established under subsection (b) each time the information is collected under subsection (d).

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the publication of the database established under subsection (b), and annually thereafter, the Director shall submit to Congress a report including—

paragraph.text: a description of the data collected and analyzed under this section related to corporate offenses, including an analysis of recidivism, offenses and alleged offenses, and enforcement actions;
an estimate of the impact of corporate offenses on victims and the public; and

recommendations, developed in consultation with the Attorney General, for legislative or administrative actions to improve the ability of Federal agencies to monitor, respond to, and deter instances of corporate offenses.

subsection.text: Section 3520A(b) of title 44, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (4), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in paragraph (5), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

identify ways in which a Federal agency (as defined in section 305 of title I of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968) that carries out an enforcement action (as defined in that section) with respect to a corporate offense (as defined in that section) can improve the collection, digitalization, tabulation, sharing, and publishing of information under that section, and the standardization of those processes, in order to carry out that section.
